metadata.titel_preek: The Good News of Cosmic Regime Change

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The 'Cosmic Regime Change' where the crucified Jesus ascends to the throne of God to govern the world with caring fidelity and generosity.

tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus now is 'high and lifted up' in majesty
the one who shares God’s power and rules over all the earth
God gives the desolate a home to live in
He leads out the prisoners to prosperity

object.identificatie: Cosmic Order / Restoration of the Vulnerable

zender.identificatie: The Ancient Liturgical Tradition / The Creed
tekstueel_bewijs: the poetic, imaginative claim of the church
It is a claim made in our creed

ontvanger.identificatie: The Vulnerable (Orphans, Widows, Prisoners) and the Church
tekstueel_bewijs: Father of orphans and protector of widows
This prescientific formulation... gives us imagery

tegenstander.identificatie: Anxiety, Greed, and the 'Ideology of Exclusion'
tekstueel_bewijs: contemporary loud posturing... is about anxiety
ideology at work among us that wants to make the world very small
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is framed as a systemic 'regime' of fear and exclusion that contradicts the governance of God.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The ethical response of the believer to the new management.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer ('We')
secundair_narratief_programma.object: Coherence with the new rule (Love, Generosity, Peace)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The preacher explicitly states that because the regime has changed (Program 1), we are 'pledged and empowered' to act differently (Program 2).

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: God's Decree → New Management/Mercy → The Church/Vulnerable

voorbeelden_god_subject: God gives the desolate a home
Jesus rules over all the earth
voorbeelden_mens_subject: we may move our life into coherence
we are pledged and empowered to act differently

voorbeelden: must love their brothers and sisters also
you can decide day by day
imagine that the cloud is the throne room
take the claim as a majestic poetic affirmation
Jesus... is able to do on a cosmic scale

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'Power' of the new King which creates a new 'Possibility' for the subjects. It is an empowerment-oriented grace theology.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from the anxiety of 'Moral Certitudes' (~S1) to the 'Cosmic Power' of the Ascension (S1), contrasting it with the 'Wicked/Greedy' (S2).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by the 'Regime Change'—the objective reality of Jesus' rule makes the old ways 'inappropriate'.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: S2 (Anxiety/Greed) is treated as a powerful, devouring social reality.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is fundamentally theocentric. It defines the Christian life as a response to an objective, cosmic fact (the Ascension) rather than a set of requirements to earn God's favor.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: If we accept this particular scenario... we may move our life

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God is an ally to those whom society would hold in bondage
The world is under new management. Think of us under new management... Be glad, be obedient.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures are not used as moral examples; Jesus is the sole active agent.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief from anxiety; sense of being protected and empowered.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Soteriology is cosmic and objective (Christus Victor/Regime Change).

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'Cosmic' to the 'Ethical' is handled via the metaphor of 'New Management'.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'prescientific' imagery and 'real authority'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: The claim that the earth is ordered differently because of the one who governs it.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon mentions 'empowered' but focuses more on the external 'Regime' than the internal Spirit.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is seen as a 'system' of greed and anxiety that 'devours' society.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God/Jesus as the primary Subject. The 'Regime Change' metaphor effectively subordinates ethics to soteriology.

identificatie_herstel.strategie: Continue emphasizing the 'beneficiary' status of the hearer.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Connect the 'Ascended Lord' with the 'Indwelling Spirit' to bridge the gap between the cloud and the heart.

tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Connect 'Anxiety' more deeply to the 'Power of Death' which Jesus defeated.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: To make the 'Regime Change' feel even more necessary.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in theocentric preaching that uses poetic imagery to establish the priority of God's action.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'Poetic Imagery', Greimas reveals that this imagery functions as a 'Helper' to establish Jesus as the 'Subject' of cosmic history.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would focus on the 'Canaanite' roots of Psalm 68; semiotics shows how that 'Power' actant is transferred to the person of Jesus.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas highlights that the 'Anxiety' mentioned is not just a feeling but a 'Counter-Subject' or 'Opponent' attempting to seize the throne.

appendices.notities: The sermon avoids the 'Exemplarism' trap by making the 'Regime Change' an objective reality rather than a subjective imitation.
